data.title: "This Bike is a Pipe Bomb"
data.meta_description:
You can't buy this kind of publicity - especially if you're just a punk outfit from Pensacola FLA:

http://www.cnn.com/2009/US/02/16/tenn.bike.bomb/index.html
data.text:
PS: I've seen the stickers on a bike - anybody who would think that the sticker is advertising an actual pipe bomb - is an idiot - IMHO

At least they didn't blow the dude's bike up this time.

Girl I work with has one of their stickers on her bike. She wanted to know just what the hell kind of idiot would be likely to put that on a real pipe bomb. I figure probably the same people who are likely to try blowing up a freeway overpass with a Lite Brite.

In Australia, you can approach the Prime Minister with an executioner's ax while he's out walking and get a hug - but don't try it with a running chainsaw...

A sticker on a bike? Come on guys!

Last year, my wife's mother and grandmother were checking their luggage at the airport. The ticket agent commented that it was amazing my wife's grandmother still had a driver's license at 95 years of age. My mother-in-law commented "Oh yeah, she's a real firecracker". They wouldn't let grandma on the plane. Detained her for two hours - full cavity search and everything.

I call BS! Full cavity search for Grammy? They're definitely sticklers but that's a bit too far. No way!

Stickler my eye! Someone has a granny fetish!

Last year, my wife's mother and grandmother were checking their luggage at the airport. The ticket agent commented that it was amazing my wife's grandmother still had a driver's license at 95 years of age. My mother-in-law commented "Oh yeah, she's a real firecracker". They wouldn't let grandma on the plane. Detained her for two hours - full cavity search and everything.

Please tell me you are kidding.
